title: Bug 17825 - ControlExampleText beeps when SWT.MULTI is chosen
description: Choosing SWT.MULTI in the ControlExampleText causes a beep sound, which is not expected behavior. The beep sound is also triggered when other buttons are clicked.
OB: When SWT.MULTI is chosen in the ControlExampleText, a beep sound is heard. Clicking on other buttons in the example also triggers the beep sound.
EB: When SWT.MULTI is chosen in the ControlExampleText, no beep sound should be heard. Clicking on other buttons in the example should not trigger the beep sound.
SR:
1. Launch the ControlExampleText.
2. Choose the SWT.MULTI option.
3. Observe if any beep sound is heard.
4. Click on other buttons in the example and check if the beep sound is produced.
